name: ChurchSearch
description:
Church search is a future, fullstack web application that seeks to connect individuals to faith-based organizations through a collection of questions that both parties take, which the webapp uses to associate individual to organization.

Implemented Features

  • User authentication, using a combination of short-lived JSON web tokens, and a long-lived refresh tokens.
  • Backend database creation, and API interaction using Express.js and Prisma, with Typescript as the language of choice.

To Be Implemented

  • A frontend client, which handles API communications, created with the newest version of Angular.
  • Hosting of the webapp, using a combination of Google SQL Databases, Google Cloud Run, and Google Filestore.

name: Dungeon Crawler
description:
Dungeon Crawler is a small, student video game created with Rust, C# and Unity Engine. It features online multiplayer, with client to server communications.

Implemented Features

  • Server UDP communications, with reliable datagram messaging.
  • Server controlled-state, communicated to and manipulated by clients.
  • Unique AI features, such as A* pathfinding and state-based decision-making.
  • Client-side rendering of game environment.

name: Resourceful Rails
description:
Resourceful Rails was a team effort between three students, including myself.

Features Implemented By Me

  • A* multi-Pathfinding, with algorithms focusing on shortest distance priority and shortest weight priority.
  • Graph data structure, with dfs vertex-set transform method.
